titles.title: Authorizing the Architect of the Capitol to permit temporary construction and other work on the Capitol Grounds that may be necessary for construction of a building on Constitution Avenue Northwest, between 2nd Street Northwest and Louisiana Avenue Northwest.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, Hazardous Materials and Pipeline Transportation.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Mr. Franks moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 167.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 1608 proposed by Senator Gorton for Senator McConnell.
Amendment SP 1608 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate with amendments by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Shuster asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendments.

vote.text: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendments Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings, Hazardous Materials and Pipeline Transportation
committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 8/5/1999--Passed Senate amended. Authorizes the Architect of the Capitol (AOC) to permit temporary construction and other work on the Capitol Grounds that may be necessary for the demolition of the existing building of the Carpenters and Joiners of America and the construction of a new building of such organization on Constitution Avenue, N.W., between 2nd Street, N.W., and Louisiana Avenue, N.W., in a manner consistent with the terms of this resolution, beginning August 6, 1999, and ending October 31, 2001, or for a longer period if the AOC determines it necessary.
